alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Butte, western Lawrence, west central Pennington, northeastern Weston and southeastern Crook Counties through 915 PM MDT... At 829 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 2 miles north of Sundance to 2 miles south of Moskee to 2 miles north of Redbank Spring Campground. Movement was north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sundance and Warren Peak around 835 PM MDT. Cement Ridge Lookout around 840 PM MDT. O`Neil Pass around 845 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Aladdin, Cheyenne Crossing, Crow Peak, Beulah, Terry Peak, Savoy, Roughlock Falls, Iron Creek Lake, Lead, Deadwood, Central City, Bridal Veil Falls and Spearfish Canyon. This includes... Interstate 90 in South Dakota between Mile Markers 1 and 16. Interstate 90 in Wyoming between Mile Markers 182 and 207. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for northwestern and west central South Dakota...and northeastern Wyoming.
